creator: christ1

content: Well, it's plain text, lacking specific controls for alignment. There is an addon, external editor, that may help, but I have no experience with it. You also face the issue of whatever font the recipient is using. Generally, if you're emailing to private individuals, it's a tossup on whether their email client is set for HTML or not, so messages that are dependent on formatting, may not achieve the objective.
creator: davidsk

content: Are you composing in HTML? If so, then: At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button â‰¡ > Settings > Composition > HTML Style Uncheck "Use Paragraph format instead of Body text by default"

creator: christ1

content:
1. Tools/Import, Import from a file, Import address books, sqlite format, select abook.sqlite or history.sqlite, or abook-1.sqlite, abook-2.sqlite... from the old profile.

2. Copy persdict.dat from the old profile.

3. Copy msgFilterRules.dat files from Mail/<popservername> and ImapMail/<imapservername> to similar folders in new profile.
creator: sfhowes

content:
'Customize Toolbar' is from the Message Header Toolbar Customize add-on.

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/msghdr-toolbar-customize/versions/
creator: sfhowes

content:
Personal Address Book is abook.sqlite (.mab in older versions) and Collected Addresses is history.sqlite (or .mab), both in the profile folder. You might also see other .mab files or abook-1.sqlite, abook-2.sqlite etc.

Tools/Import, Import from file, address books....
creator: sfhowes

content: Click the ... in the Folder Pane Header (View/Folders to show) (see picture).
